Api Object¶

class pylol.api.Api(key)[source]¶

A wrapper class for pulling data from the Elophant API.

Parameters:key (string) – API developer key.

If you do not yet have a developer key to access the API you can request a new one from http://elophant.com/developers/new.

request(path, region=None)[source]¶

Send a request to the Elophant API.

Parameters:
  • path (string) – Path to the desired API resource.
  • region (string) – Which game region to query.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the decoded JSON data.

Makes an API request to the given path and returns the decoded JSON as a dictionary.

path will have any leading or trailing slash stripped before the request is made, so you should not include them if you can avoid it.

region should be one of NA for North America, EUW for Europe West, EUNE for Europe North East and BR for Brazil. If region is omitted or None is supplied it will default to NA. Upper or lower case strings can be passed as path is not case-sensitive.

get_items()[source]¶

Returns data on each item.

Returns:A list of dictionaries.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/items for more information.

get_champions()[source]¶

Returns a mapping of champion IDs to names.

Returns:A list of dictionaries.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/champions for more information

get_summoner(name, region=None)[source]¶

Returns some basic information on a summoner.

Parameters:
  • name (string) – The summoner name to search for.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the summoner data.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/summoner for more information.

Note

The revisionDate field returned from the API will be converted into a proper unix timestamp.

get_mastery_pages(sid, region=None)[source]¶

Returns each of a Summoner’s current mastery pages.

Parameters:
  • sid (int) – The summoner’s summonerId.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing info on the mastery pages.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/mastery_pages for more information.

get_rune_pages(sid, region=None)[source]¶

Returns each of a Summoner’s current rune pages.

Parameters:
  • sid (int) – The summoner’s summonerId.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing info on the rune pages.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/rune_pages for more information.

get_recent_games(aid, region=None)[source]¶

Returns information and game stats from up to 10 of the Summoner’s most recent games.

Parameters:
  • aid (int) – The summoner’s accountId.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the game data.

If there are no recent games played by the summoner, an empty dictionary will be returned instead.

Warning

Make sure that aid contains the accountId of the summoner and not their summonerId that is used by most other Api functions.

Note

The createDate field in each game’s gameStatistics will be converted into a proper unix timestamp.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/recent_games for more information.

get_summoner_names(sids, region=None)[source]¶

Maps the supplied summoner IDs to their associated summoner names.

Parameters:
  • sids (list) – A list of summoner IDs.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A list containing the summoner names in the same order the summoner IDs were provided.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/summoner_names for more information.

get_leagues(sid, region=None)[source]¶

Returns information on each league the summoner is currently in.

Parameters:
  • sid (int) – The summoner’s summonerId.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing info on each league.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/leagues for more information.

get_ranked_stats(aid, season='current', region=None)[source]¶

Returns all ranked stats for the specified summoner and season.

Parameters:
  • aid (int) – The summoner’s accountId.
  • season (string) – Which season to get stats for.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the stats.

Warning

Make sure that aid contains the accountId of the summoner and not their summonerId that is used by most other Api functions.

The optional parameter season should be one of 'one', 'two' or 'current' (the default).

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/ranked_stats for more information.

get_summoner_team_info(sid, region=None)[source]¶

Returns information on each team the summoner is currently in.

Parameters:
  • sid (int) – The summoner’s summonerId.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the team information.

If the summoner is not a member of any teams, an empty dictionary will be returned instead.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/summoner_team_info for more information.

get_in_progress_game_info(name, region=None)[source]¶

Returns player info, picks, bans and observer info for the game the specified summoner is currently in (if any).

Parameters:
  • name (string) – The summoner name to search for.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the game information.

If the summoner is not currently in a game, an empty dictionary will be returned instead.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/in_progress_game_info for more information.

get_team(tid, region=None)[source]¶

Returns information on the requested team.

Parameters:
  • tid (string) – The team’s teamId.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing all info on the requested team.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/team for more information.

get_find_team(name, region=None)[source]¶

Funtionally identical to get_team() but will search on team name or tag instead of ID.

Parameters:
  • name (string) – A team’s tag or name.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

If a matching team is found, a dictionary containing all info on the requested team.

Elophant asks that this method be used sparingly and only if the teamId of a team is not known.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/find_team for more information.

get_team_end_of_game_stats(tid, gid, region=None)[source]¶

Returns very detailed statistics about the requested ranked match.

Parameters:
  • tid (string) – The team’s teamId.
  • gid (int) – The gameId to look up.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the match statistics.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/team_end_of_game_stats for more information.

get_team_ranked_stats(tid, region=None)¶

Returns stats of each player in the specified team.

Parameters:
  • tid (string) – The team’s teamId.
  • region (string) – Which game region to search in.
Returns:

A dictionary containing the stats for each team member.

Refer to http://elophant.com/developers/docs/team_ranked_stats for more information.
